h3. Summary
Overlapping Text in JIRA UI for user profile page when German language is selected as default language in JIRA

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.2.1
* JIRA 6.4.14
* Chrome(latest version)
* Firefox(latest version)
* Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go To JIRA Administration page and change default language to German
# Click on user profile page
# Under Summary page observe the behaviour for groups 

h3. Expected Results
The groups are displayed with proper spacing in JIRA UI

h3. Actual Results
The information for groups overlaps in JIRA UI as shown in image below
!overlaps.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Note
This behaviour only happens when the default language is selected as German

h3.Workaround
Currently No workaround is available
fields.summary: Text Overlapping in JIRA UI

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no any permission that can be set for the [Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA064/Creating+Release+Notes] specifically except the Browse Projects permission. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Admin must be able to edit the Release Notes permissions or add people to view the created Release Notes.
fields.summary: Able to configure permissions for Release Notes

fields.description:
h3. Description of Problem

After restoring a Cloud backup to JIRA server, indexing failed with the following errors in atlassian-jira.log
{noformat}
2016-08-19 21:18:10,996 JiraTaskExectionThread-3 WARN sysadmin 1277x313x1 v5jhvz 10.61.1.234 /secure/admin/jira/IndexReIndex.jspa [c.a.jira.index.AccumulatingResultB$
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: shareType should not be null!
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:29)
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:140)
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.java:128)
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.java:83)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:64)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.reIndexAll(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:48)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.doReindex(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:25)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.call(ReIndexAsyncIndexerCommand.java:16)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.index.AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.call(AbstractAsyncIndexerCommand.java:24)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:453)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:421)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException: shareType should not be null!
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.report(FutureTask.java:122)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:192)
...
2016-08-19 19:07:19,414 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR sysadmin 1144x114x1 1mg9eth 10.60.2.234 /secure/admin/XmlRestor$
com.atlassian.jira.index.IndexingFailureException: Indexing completed with 2 errors
        at com.atlassian.jira.index.AccumulatingResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(AccumulatingResultBuilder.java:150)
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.reIndex(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.java:1$
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.jav$
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.jav$
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.activate(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.java:$
        at com.atlassian.jira.sharing.index.DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.activate(DefaultSharedEntityIndexManager.java:$
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.activate(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:134)
        at com.atlassian.jira.util.index.CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.activate(CompositeIndexLifecycleManager.java:128)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.reindex(DefaultDataImportService.java:955)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:749)
        at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:320)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
        at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)


{noformat}
h3. Cause

In Cloud versions, there is a new Share Type for filters for any logged in User. This value translates to "loggedin" in thesharepermissions table. Unfortunately, this value does not exist for JIRA Server, and it is interpreted as being null on the table.
h3. Expected Behavior

Indexing does not fail after restore from JIRA Cloud.
 * One solution might be to fix this value during the XML restore process

h3. Workaround
 # Stop JIRA
 # Run this database query: {{update sharepermissions set sharetype = 'global' where sharetype = 'loggedin';}}
 # Start JIRA
 # Run a lock index to re-build the indexes.
fields.summary: Indexing Failed after Cloud Backup Restoration in JIRA Server due to "shareType should not be null!"
Add information about Versions for JSON importer

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62503].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Upgrading of JIRA does not remove the older/deprecated jar files which may cause start up problem after the upgrade. This is especially when the instance is carried over the upgrade from JIRA 5 or older.
This applies to 'stock' JIRA plugins like JIRA Software or JIRA Service Desk, for example, when JIRA 8.5 is upgraded to JIRA 8.13, the Jira Software 8.5 .jar files will remain in the installed-plugins folder

h3. Suggested Solution
During upgrade of JIRA, JIRA to check deprecated jar files and remove them accordingly before the start up.

h3. Workaround 
Remove the deprecated jar files manually.
fields.summary: Auto remove deprecated jar files(plugins) after upgrading JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since the JIRA header and Issue Operation Buttons like _Edit_, _Comment_, _Assign_ and etc are locked upon navigation, it's blocking the text when user uses the hyperlink to view the anchored part of the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
# Create an issue with a long description. (i) The description should be long enough for the page scroll bar to appear.
# Put an anchor somewhere in the first part of the Description using. (i) You should still be able to scroll the page after the line of the anchor.
 {code}{anchor:text}This is a sample text.{code}
# Navigate to the anchored text by appending {{#text}} to the end of the page URL. For example, {{http://localhost:8080/browse/TEST-1#text}}
(i) Please refer to the attached video for the steps to reproduce the problem and also the reported behavior.

h3. Expected Result
The first line of the Description you see should be the anchored text

h3. Actual Result
The first line of the Description you see is actually about 6 lines after the anchored text. Users have to scroll upward to view the beginning of the anchored text

h3. Notes
-This doesn't happen in 7.2.0, as the JIRA header and the Issue Operation Buttons are not locked while scrolling.-
Requires Issue Nav Stalker enabled
fields.summary: JIRA header and the Issue Operation Buttons are blocking the display of a specified anchored text in the Description or Comment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Multiple concurrent login attempts may throw a UserNotFoundException due to a race condition. User will get 500 error as a response.
 JIRA doesn't expect to have high concurrency for authentication requests. So initially problem is caused by very extensive authentications and better way to handle that is to reuse user session. See docs: [jira-rest-api-example-cookie-based-authentication|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-rest-apis/jira-rest-api-tutorials/jira-rest-api-example-cookie-based-authentication]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a script which performs multiple REST login attempts every second

h3. Expected Results

All login attempts will be successful.
h3. Actual Results

The login attempt will occasionally fail due to race condition. 
 The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-jira.log file:
{noformat}
2016-06-06 08:21:47,545 http-bio-443-exec-349 ERROR      [o.a.c.c.C.[.[localhost].[/].[default]] Servlet.service() for servlet [default] in context with path [] threw exception
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.UserNotFoundException: User <username> does not exist
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.setUserAttribute(CrowdServiceImpl.java:413)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.CrowdServiceImpl.setUserAttribute(CrowdServiceImpl.java:392)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.DelegatingCrowdService.setUserAttribute(DelegatingCrowdService.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.core.FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.setUserAttribute(FilteredCrowdServiceImpl.java:51)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginStoreImpl.setLong(LoginStoreImpl.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginStoreImpl.recordLoginAttempt(LoginStoreImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.RecoveryLoginStore.recordLoginAttempt(RecoveryLoginStore.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginManagerImpl.recordLoginAttempt(LoginManagerImpl.java:314)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.LoginManagerImpl.onLoginAttempt(LoginManagerImpl.java:215)
	at com.atlassian.jira.security.login.JiraElevatedSecurityGuard.onSuccessfulLoginAttempt(JiraElevatedSecurityGuard.java:30)
	... 13 filtered
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.module.servlet.RestSeraphFilter.doFilter(RestSeraphFilter.java:37)
	... 73 filtered
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}
h3. Notes
 * Subsequent attempt at login will succeed
 * Doesn't seem to affect Internal Directory
 * Problem relates to new code introduced in 7.0

h3. Workaround

Add the following JIRA property into {{<JIRA_HOME>/jira-config.properties}} (create files if it's empty):
{code:java}
# JRA-62500 disable full user cache
jira.fullUserCache=false
{code}
 * JIRA will need to be restarted for this change to take affect.

That will switch to _lazy user cache_ which doesn't have this race condition.
 (!) That being said, enabling this will heavily impact REST performance and scenarios when JIRA is used as crowd server.
 # Every call for userCount will hit database instead of cache.
 # Another thing is that users will not be loaded to cache at once. It may slow down some queries before it's fully loaded. (They will be loaded when needed)
fields.summary: Multiple concurrent login attempts may throw a 500 error/UserNotFoundException due to a race condition

fields.description:
We internally discovered that the *HipChat For JIRA plugin* had a resource that combined user input into a velocity template source and subsequently rendered it. Authenticated attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that have a vulnerable version of the HipChat For JIRA plugin enabled. To exploit this issue attackers need to be able to access the JIRA web interface and log into JIRA. *Vulnerable versions of the HipChat for JIRA plugin were bundled by default with JIRA since* JIRA version 6.3.5, up to but not including 6.4.11 (the fixed version).


*Affected versions:*
* All versions of *HipChat For JIRA plugin* from 1.3.2 before 6.30.0 are affected by this vulnerability. 
* All versions of *JIRA* from 6.3.5 before 6.4.11 are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
* The HipChat for JIRA plugin can be updated through JIRA's addon manager. For instructions on how to update the HipChat For JIRA plugin see https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+add-ons.
* JIRA Server 6.4.11 is available for download from https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download.

*Risk Mitigation:*
* If you are unable to upgrade your JIRA server, then as a temporary workaround, you can disable or uninstall the HipChat For JIRA plugin in JIRA.

  

For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/IcBKLg].
fields.summary: CVE-2015-5603: HipChat for JIRA plugin - Velocity Template Injection

fields.description:
The *HipChat for JIRA plugin* exposed the secret key it used to communicate with a linked HipChat service in various pages. For this vulnerability to affect your *JIRA* instance you must have a HipChat integration established. To exploit this issue in *JIRA* versions 7.0.0 and higher, attackers need to have access to a JIRA account. In *JIRA* versions before 7.0.0, such as 6.4.x, attackers only need access to the JIRA web interface. Using the secret key attackers can gain full control over a linked HipChat instance.

\\
*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of *HipChat for JIRA plugin* from 6.26.0 before 7.8.17 are affected by this vulnerability.
 * All versions of *JIRA* from 6.4.8 before 7.0.11(the fixed version for 7.0.x) and from 7.1.0 before 7.1.10 (the fixed version for 7.1.x) are affected by this vulnerability are affected by this vulnerability.

\\
*Fix:*
 * The *HipChat for JIRA plugin* can be updated through JIRA's add-on manager. For instructions on how to update the HipChat For JIRA plugin see [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+add-ons].
 * *JIRA Server* 7.2.1 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download].
 * *JIRA Server* 7.1.10 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].
 * *JIRA Server* 7.0.11 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].

\\
*Risk Mitigation:*
 * If you are unable to upgrade your JIRA server or the HipChat for JIRA plugin, then as a temporary workaround, you can disable or uninstall the HipChat for JIRA plugin in JIRA.

\\
For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/w4GbMg].
fields.summary: CVE-2016-6668 - The HipChat plugin for various products leaks the secret key it uses to communicate with a linked HipChat instance.

h3. Summary
If the assignee field is added to the create issue screen, and a the permission scheme is set with "any logged in user" for Create issue and Assign User, BUT *DOES NOT* include the Browse Project permission.  If the user creating an issue clicks into the Assignee field they trigger a pop up error


h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
** Tested on v1000.319.1
* JIRA Server
** 7.2.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add assignee field to Create issue Screen (Default configuration)
# Using the Default Permissions scheme or creating a custom scheme which has "Application Access any Logged in user" allow permission for:
## Assign Issue
## Create Issue
#  Remove permission *Browse Project* for "any logged in user" 
# Log in as a user that does not have Browse Project permission
# User also has browse users global permission
# Create issue in the project
# Select the assignee field

h3. Expected Results:
assignee field works as you are allowed to add assignee and browse users via permission scheme, or a warning indicating "you do not have adequate permissions to browse project details, Please contact your administrator" is displayed

h3. Actual Results
A popup warning is triggered:
{quote}
<URL_TO_INSTANCE> says:
The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the results of this operation.

[ ] Prevent this page from creating additional dialogs.
{quote}
!Screen Shot 2016-09-09 at 10.21.50 AM.png|thumbnail!

The following 404 appears in development tools javascript console
{code}
batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=tru…:6011 GET https://<INSTANCE_NAME>/rest/api/latest/user/assignable/multiProje…earch?username=&projectKeys=TEST&maxResults=50&startAt=0&_=1473435327305 404 (Not Found)XMLHttpRequest.send @ batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=tru…:6011send @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:213ajax @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:207u @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1289j.makeRequest @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1289makeRequest @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3407incubateRequest @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3407execute @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3407execute @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3407execute @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3407requestSuggestions @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410requestSuggestions @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3834(anonymous function) @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1271_handleCharacterInput @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410_handleCharacterInput @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3428(anonymous function) @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1271_handleCharacterInput @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3834(anonymous function) @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1271_handleDown @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410click @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:3410_dispatchers.(anonymous function) @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1274dispatch @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:120h @ batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:112
batch.js?atlassian.aui.raphael.disabled=true&locale=en-US:1289 ajax[38127306] error : {
successful  : false,
status      : 404,
statusText  : error,
hasData     : true,
readyState  : 4,
requestId   : 38127306,
aborted     : undefined,
}
{code}
 
h3. Notes:
Testing discovered:
- If you know a user name you can add it to the field dismiss the error and create the issue and the assignee will populate
- An additional error occurs if you select the option *Prevent this page From Creating Additional Dialogs.*
-- After selecting the prevent option
-- If you try to modify the assignee field the Page locks up Indefinitely and cannot be escaped (ESC key, cancel Button)
--- there are two ways to exit the page at this point:
----  refreshing the page, and erase all content
---- Select the Create Button, but no other content can be added to the Create issue screen once locked, and as the user does not have browse project permission the issue cannot me changed later


h3.Workaround's
# Add Reporter to the *browse Project Permission* which will allow the user to View any Issue that they are the reporter on. 
# Use [Issue collector | https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-the-issue-collector-802592637.html] which can set the assignee to the project lead with the use of use the Default Assignee of a project (Project Lead) for issues created.
# Remove the assignee field from the create issue screen
# Remove the user's association from the Assign issue permission to remove the field as an option on create for users without the permission
# Remove the user's association from the Create issue permission so the user cannot create issue in the project that they cannot browse

To remove the Locking issue from selecting *Prevent this page From Creating Additional Dialogs.* Flush Browser cache and the error popup will return.
fields.summary: Create Issue without Browse Project triggers 404 on assignee field

h3. Summary

When attempting to access JIRA in the mobile view, the side bar menu does not allow any actions to be selected. This behaviour can be reproduced on SAC as well as clean instances.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into your JIRA instance form the iOS browser
 # Bring up the side bar
 # Attempt to select your favorite filters or any options within the sideba

h3. Expected Results
 - selecting your filter brings up the issues in the filter.
 - selecting your favorite filters brings up your filters.

h3. Actual Results
 - unable to select any options from the side bar

h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile View Side Bar not clickable

	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start JIRA
 # Make frequent requests to a url that does not exist on the JIRA instance while JIRA is still initializing (eg. localhost:PORT/something)

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should start up normally.
h3. Actual Results

JIRA throws an internal server error.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Seems to be happening only in very specific environmental conditions (eg. Java version, installer type)

h3. Workaround
 * Block web access to the instance during start up to prevent the bad request from hitting JIRA during startup such as the following examples:
 ** Change the port in {{server.xml}} during startup or upgrade to avoid users unintentionally accessing URLs which may cause such problems
 ** Leverage a firewall on the server hosting JIRA to block the port during startup
 ** In cases where a reverse proxy or balancer is in front of JIRA this can be shut down during startup

{panel}
NOTE: The same symptoms are sometimes seen due to corrupted plugin caches or /work directory.  If troubleshooting this issue, clearing these directories may resolve the issue:
 * /JIRA_HOME/plugins/.osgi-plugins/
 * /JIRA_HOME/plugins/.bundled-plugins/
 * /JIRA_INSTALL/work/{panel}
fields.summary: Users see 500 errors for every request in Jira after a restart due to bad URL requests during startup

To reproduce:

* Modify the LDAP host entry in the operating system's host file to point to a new IP address
* Perform a user directory sync

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The preparation to upgrade JIRA is very cumbersome. 
# There are too much to read, but there are no checklists to help us in determining if we have got some important upgrade tasks covered. 
# There are things that we might have missed out but the instance is upgraded with problems, eventually, we need to roll back to fix the problems.

h3. Suggested Solutions
* An upgrade hub to suggest upgrade tasks based on the requirements and more intuitive. For example
** from and to JIRA versions
*** Any blocker issues for a particular version upgrade?
** from and to JIRA Software/Service Desk versions
** database server type and collations
*** Is the currently using database server version and driver still supported in the targeted JIRA version? If not, indicate the supported versions.
** license(s) validity
* A centralized knowledge base of all documentation related to Upgrading JIRA i.e. Upgrade method, process, upgrade notes

h3. Workaround
* Test upgrade and reach out to JIRA Support if there're any problems in the UI or errors in the logs
* Reaching out to Support before performing upgrade might help to avoid some problems too, however, Support can only advise based on known issues and documented requirements. There are too many causes of failed upgrade or errors varies because of environment and data, hence test upgrade is the best approach.
fields.summary: As an admin, I hope Upgrading JIRA can be less tedious

2016-09-07 18:57:00,154 DEBUG [] Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.SubscriptionSingleRecepientMailQueueItem owner: 'user1(user1)' user1    Mail Queue Service Got transport: [smtps://test@smtp.gmail.com]. Connecting

h3. Summary
New JIRA 7.2.1 installation or upgrading to JIRA 7.2.1 makes Instance Health Plugin to be incompatible with the current JIRA version.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install new fresh JIRA 7.2.1 instance.
# Navigate to _Manage add-ons_ page.
# Search for "Instance Health Plugin" with the filter set to "All add-ons" - you can see that the plugin is disabled.

h3. Expected Results
Since Instance Health Plugin (jira-healthcheck-plugin-2.1.14.jar) is a System Add-on, the bundled plugin should be the version that is compatible with JIRA 7.2.1.

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-jira.log}} file:
{noformat}
 ___ FAILED PLUGIN REPORT _____________________
    
    1 plugin failed to load during JIRA startup.
  'com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin' - 'Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Instance Health Plugin'  failed to load.
    		Cannot start plugin: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin
    			Unresolved constraint in bundle com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin [91]: Unable to resolve 91.0: missing requirement [91.0] osgi.wiring.package; (&(osgi.wiring.package=com.atlassian.support.healthcheck)(version>=2.0.11))
    
    		It was loaded from /jira/jira-dev72-node3/atlassian-jira-software-7.2.1-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/jira-healthcheck-plugin-2.1.14.jar
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
To manually upgrade the plugin:
# Go to [JIRA Instance Health Plugin - Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin/versions].
# Download the version 2.1.15
# [Upload the downloaded OBR file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Installing+add-ons#Installingadd-ons-Installingbyfileupload] to JIRA at the _Manage add-ons_ page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62455].
  {panel}

h3. Issue Summary

When a custom field configuration is edited and then an issue using that configuration is edited, the *custom field values revert to null or the default option*.

Users are not likely to notice unless they are attempting to change that field. If they do happen to notice they cannot see the original value in order to restore it to the correct value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom Field called "Test" using the "Select List (single choice)" type.
 # In the default/Global field configuration, configure three options: A, B, C.
 # Create an issue in Project FOO and set the field value to "B".
 # Create a new custom field context.
 # Configure the same three options for the field in this configuration: A, B, C.
 # Configure Project FOO to use this field configuration for the type of issue you created in Step 3.
 # Click "Edit" for the issue you created previously.

h3. Expected Results
 * After the field configuration is changed, existing values for the field should be preserved unless they cannot be mapped to options in the new configuration.
 * Alternatively, JIRA should highlight the modified field values in some way so the user knows they must make a change in the Edit screen.

h3. Actual Results
 * If the user does not modify anything on the "Edit" screen and clicks update, the field value will be changed to either 'None' or the first available field option.
 ** If the field is *optional*, the field will be set to 'None' in the Edit screen.
 ** If the field is *required*, the field will be set to the first available option, not the default option, in the Edit screen.

h3. Workaround
Administrators: After changing the field configuration for a project, for each custom field value you wish to preserve...
 # Search for issues that have the custom field set to that value.
 # Bulk edit the issues to set them to the correct value in the new field configuration (even if that value matches the default field config)

Detailed description and steps for the workaround are at [Change Context for an Existing Custom Field Without Losing Old Data|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-context-for-an-existing-custom-field-without-losing-old-data-674990056.html].
fields.summary: Changing a custom field configuration changes the values of custom fields when issues are edited

h3. Summary

Unable to move issue to another issue type when the source issue type has a subtask (with no Affects Version value) and the target issue type has "Affects Versions" as "Required".

Steps to reproduce:

# Create Field Configuration with "Affects Versions" hidden.
# Create another Field Configuration with "Affects Versions" required.
# Go to Field Configuration Scheme and create a new Field Configuration Scheme.
# Associate the first field configuration with an issue type and associate another issue type with the next field configuration.
# Associate the new Field Configuration Scheme with a project.
# Create an issue with an issue type which has "Affects Versions" hidden.
# Create sub-tasks for the newly created issue.
# Move the issue to the another issue type which has the "Affects Versions" required.


h3. Environment

JIRA 6.4.14, JIRA 7.1.9, JIRA 7.2.1


h3. Expected Results

User is able to map specific Versions under "Affects Versions" while moving issue to target issue type which has "Affects Versions" as "Required".


h3. Actual Results

User is not able to move the issue because they are not able to map the "Affects Version".

 !Bug.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

None.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
Issue link event is not working with Webhook.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.9
* JIRA 7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request bin at http://requestb.in/.
# Edit the Webhook which is going to be analyzed, replacing the Webhook URL with the request bin URL (e.g. http://requestb.in/1hz8te41).
# Under *Features status change* , tick for *Issue Links*
# Then , test to link issue .
# Check the request using the request bin URL (e.g. http://requestb.in/1hz8te41?inspect).

For more information about troubleshooting webhook , can refer [How to collect data for Atlassian Support for troubleshooting JIRA WebHooks|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-collect-data-for-atlassian-support-for-troubleshooting-jira-webhooks-397083035.html] documentation.

h3. Expected Results
There's request fire to the external link.

h3. Actual Results
No event fire to the external link

h3. Note
The problem kinda similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8505 . There's no event for listener to "Issue Links" . However , it doesn't mention about Webhook .
fields.summary: Issue Link event is not working for Webhook
Jira Agile: possibility to estimate remaining story point

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62443].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When anonymous access is enabled on both JIRA and Confluence and a page is linked to a JIRA issue, the link to the page in JIRA will display _You do not have permission to view this page_.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.305.0
* Confluence 1000.260.0
* JIRA 6.4.13
* JIRA 7.2.3
* Confluence 5.10.4

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have anonymous access enabled on both JIRA and Confluence. Page and issue are both available to anonymous users.
# Link the page to the JIRA issue.

h3. Expected Results
Page title is displayed properly.

h3. Actual Results
Following message is displayed instead of the page title: _You do not have permission to view this page_.
Clicking on the link will redirect you to the correct page which is indeed accessible.

h3.Workaround
No workaround but the page is accessible anyway.

h3. Notes
Logged in Jira user can see the proper name of the link and is properly redirected to Confluence after click-on.
fields.summary: In anonymous access, link to Confluence page displays "You do not have permission to view this page"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62442].
  {panel}

In JIRA 7, there is a Java API to just about everything _except_ the issue transition history, which is stored in the OS_HISTORYSTEP table with some links to CHANGEGROUPS/CHANGEITEMS for changes of workflow.

Because of the complexities of correctly reading the transition history while taking into account the potential changes in the workflow, it would be really nice to have a proper Java API (and possibly REST API as well) to properly access the transition history.

By transition history, I mean for each transition executed on an issue:
- timestamp
- transition ID 
- transition name
- author of the transition
fields.summary: Java API to OS transition history

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62440].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition:
Currently, it is mandatory to put First or Last Name in issue creation hence, when only adding a single word to the "Full Name" field, the user is still created and it will map as its Last Name. This makes it not possible to guarantee data consistency for all your user's first and last names. Also, this will reflect any Application that needs the object for other purposes.

h3. Suggested Solution:
An option where to make JIRA able to detect that there is only a single word inputted on the field and it will prevent the issue creation until the actual Full Name is provided.
fields.summary: To force user to include their First and Last Name in user creation.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62439].
  {panel}

Dear JIRA community,

As an end-user I find the possibility to reply to comments by email very useful.

Unfortunately, when I receive a notification by email, it only displays the full name of the person publishing the commenting, and if I want to reply and mention the user (so that s/he receives an e-mail notification) using the syntax [~user_id_of_the_person_to_notify], first I have to get the corresponding user id, either in the JIRA's directory or by checking the user id on the ticket in the browser.

This is not convenient cause it requires to connect / check specific webpages, so it cuts down the facility to notify directly by mentioning the user in the reply by email (as you need to know the user id), and it's time consuming / error-prone for big organizations where there are a lot of people posting comments as the user id has to be retrieved every time.

A simple solution would be to add the user id next to the labels referencing a name, so that we can directly mention the user when replying by e-mail.

For instance for the following labels (bold text would be the information to add):
 * DOE John *(doejohn)* commented on XXXX-425
 * Reporter: DOE John *(doejohn)*
 * Assignee: DOE Jane *(doejane)*

Is there a way to do this ?

Can it be an improvement for JIRA in the future ?

Thanks a lot for your help,

Best regards,

Alexandre 8)

PS: for info, a thread has been opened on Atlassian Answers but no feedback received [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40355363/display-userid-of-people-commenting-replying-to-comments-in-email-notifications]
fields.summary: Display userid of people commenting / replying to comments in email notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transitioning an issue will fail if the username of the user transitioning is longer than 60 chars.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user whos username is greater than 60 characters
# Try to transition any issue within a project

h3. Expected Results

The issue should be transitioned successfully

h3. Actual Results
The following error message is displayed in a modal window
{noformat}
Error marking step #10023 finished: root cause: while updating: [GenericEntity:OSCurrentStep][owner,][caller,thisusernameisquitelongandwillbreakworkflowtransitionshowcoolisthathey][dueDate,null][stepId,11][actionId,21][finishDate,2016-09-22 11:37:07.296][id,10023][startDate,2016-09-22 11:16:30.707][entryId,10023][status,Not Done] (SQL Exception while executing the following:UPDATE public.OS_CURRENTSTEP SET ENTRY_ID=?, STEP_ID=?, ACTION_ID=?, OWNER=?, START_DATE=?, DUE_DATE=?, FINISH_DATE=?, STATUS=?, CALLER=? WHERE ID=? (ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)))
It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.
If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
{noformat}

Along with a message in the logs along the lines of
{noformat}
2016-08-31 11:23:48,405 http-nio-8080-exec-6 jiraadministrator@atlassianjiraadministrator.com 683x77831x1 admin /secure/WorkflowUIDispatcher.jspa 2ms "UPDATE public.OS_CURRENTSTEP SET ENTRY_ID='24816', STEP_ID='1', ACTION_ID='21', OWNER='', START_DATE='2016-08-31 11:17:56.962', DUE_DATE='null', FINISH_DATE='2016-08-31 11:23:48.402', STATUS='Not Done', CALLER='jiraadministrator@atlassianjiraadministrator.com' make him the scrum master for double 07 'jirasystemadministrator@admin.com' WHERE ID='31979'"
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(60)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Manually change the column size to varchar(255) on the database or rename the affected user.
fields.summary: Unable to transition workflow when app_user.user_key exceeds 60 characters

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}

h3. Summary
User in Project role cannot be removed if the username starts with "0".

h3. Environment
*  JIRA 7.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add user with "0123" username
# Add the user to one of project role.
# Then , remove the user from the role by clicking the trash icon.

h3. Expected Results
User will be able to be remove from the role.

h3. Actual Results
User not remove from the role. Below is the screenshot of HAR file result . The request is {{http://10.60.2.204:8720/rest/api/2/project/ST/role/10002?user=123}} . The user is "123" instead of "0123"
 
 !Screen Shot 2016-09-05 at 11.00.39 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note

This problem is reproducible with groupname which starts with "0" as well.

h3.Workaround
Remove role from "Edit Project Roles for User" in User Management
fields.summary: User in Project Role cannot be removed if the username starts with "0"

Summary

Calling rest api in-parallel causes JIRA to return 500 error.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce

Call JIRA rest api for JQL search in parallel (5 threads or more)

 
h3. Actual results

Server starts returning 500 response codes
h3. Expected Result

Server response without error.

 
h3. Environment

 

Script that was used:
{code:java}
var rest = require('rest');
var mime = require('rest/interceptor/mime');

var client = rest.wrap(mime);

var baseUrl = "https://jira.example.com/rest/api/latest/";
client({path: baseUrl + "field?"}).then(function(){
  return client({ path: baseUrl + 'project' });
}).then(function (data) {
  for (var i in data.entity) {
    var e = data.entity[i];
    client({ path: baseUrl + 'search', method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' }, entity: { jql: 'project = ' + e.key} }).then(function(data) {
      return client({ path: baseUrl + 'issue/' + data.entity.issues[0].key});
    }).then(function(data) {
      if (!data.entity.key) {
        console.log(data);
      }
      console.log(data.entity.key);
    });
  }
});





{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62431].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
After the first startup, if an user uses the CSV importer under *Issues > Import issues from CSV*, the conversion of time estimates will misbehave.

*Example:* importing a file with the below data results in *Original Estimate* set to 8 minutes.

{code:none|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
Issue ID, Summary, Issue Type, Assignee, Due Date, Original Estimate
1, Test Import Task 1, Task, admin, 09/Sep/16, 28800
{code}

h3. Expected Behavior
Given our documentation on the CSV importer says that estimates should be set in seconds, the estimate for that imported issues should be 8 hours (28800 seconds / 60 = 480 minutes / 60 = 8 hours).

h3. Actual Behavior
Somehow, seconds are converted to hours correctly, but the unit is set to minutes.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a new, clean JIRA instance;
# Create a new project;
# Create a new CSV file, making sure to include a time tracking field;
# Import that file using the importer under *Issues > Import issues from CSV*;

h3. Notes
If we deactivate Time Tracking under *Administration > System > Time Tracking* and reactivate without changing any options, the importer will work correctly.

Looking at the {{propertyentry}} table with the below query, we can see a number of options that are only added after cycling Time Tracking;
{code:sql|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#6A8EB3|bgColor=#F8F8F8}
SELECT pe.id, ps.id, pn.id, pe.property_key, ps.propertyvalue, pn.propertyvalue FROM propertyentry pe 
LEFT JOIN propertynumber pn ON pe.id = pn.id AND pe.propertytype = 1
LEFT JOIN propertystring ps ON pe.id = ps.id AND pe.propertytype = 5
WHERE pe.property_key LIKE '%timetracking%'
ORDER BY 4;
{code}

h5. Before Cycle
||id||id||id||property_key||propertyvalue||propertyvalue||
|11| |11|jira.option.timetracking| |1|
|12| |12|jira.timetracking.estimates.legacy.behaviour| |0|

h5. After Cycle
||id||id||id||property_key||propertyvalue||propertyvalue||
|11| |11|jira.option.timetracking| |1|
|10362| |10362|jira.timetracking.copy.comment.to.work.desc.on.transition| |1|
|10359|10359| |jira.timetracking.days.per.week|5| |
|10361|10361| |jira.timetracking.default.unit|MINUTE| |
|12| |12|jira.timetracking.estimates.legacy.behaviour| |0|
|10360|10360| |jira.timetracking.format|pretty| |
|10358|10358| |jira.timetracking.hours.per.day|8| |

This doesn't seem to affect the administrator's CSV importer, triggered through *Administration > System > External System Import*.

h3. Workaround
Deactivate Time Tracking under *Administration > System > Time Tracking* and activate it again - without changing any options.
fields.summary: Missing Time Tracking properties on first startup causes CSV importer to misbehave
Jira REST API does not allow set Category or Issue Security to 'None'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62427].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When updating user picker value during a workflow transition screen, if the transition is blocked due to other system/workflow validator condition, after updating the field needed, the user picker value will not be updated properly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a freshly installed instance, create a transition screen which has _assignee_ field and _summary_ field
# Summary field by default has a validator hard coded to it, where this field will need to have a value
# Append the transition screen to any workflow transition
# Publish the workflow
# Trigger the transition screen by performing the needed transition
# *Change the assignee field*
# Remove the Summary value to become empty
# When saving, the update will fail due to the summary field is empty
# Insert value to summary field, and resave.

h3. Expected Results
# Issue will be able to save with updated value for both assignee field and summary

h3. Actual Result
# Assignee field is not updated accordingly
 [^bug user picker transition.mp4] 
 
h3. Notes
After some testing, it seems that installing JSU and apply plugin validator to other transition will remove the bug. User picker value are updated properly
 [^bug user picker transition2.mp4] 

h3.Workaround
Unverified at the moment, however, worth to try. 
* Install JSU and configure other validator in the workflow.
fields.summary: User Picker not updating properly in a transition screen pop-up

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62425].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently users are required to go to {{Settings -> Issues}} and to make any changes to screens related to projects.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Add feature to JIRA to the screen management can be done in Project Management page.

Improvements:

1. Screenshot #1 shows 
- Issue Type view shall help user to see if any fields on screen will now be visible and why
- Each field line shall provide link to Field Configuration when field made hidden
- Each field line shall provide quick Field Context selection (existing or new one) when field doesn't have context for this project and issue type. 

 !JIRA-UI-Improvement1.png|thumbnail! 

2. Screenshot #2 shows
- instead of single screen JIRA shall show dropdown list of all project screens available for this issue type (Create/Edit/View + workflow transition screens)

 !JIRA-UI-Improvement2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 

Edit the screens from {{Settings -> Issues}}
fields.summary: Allow screen configuration from project management page

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Today we don't have a documentation for advanced expressions in the JIRA Services page.

h3. Suggested Solution
An information showing how to use these expressions would be awesome to avoid the use of regular cron expressions (Linux) instead of quartz.
 
h3. Workaround 
The page can be similar to [this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACORESERVER072/Constructing+cron+expressions+for+a+filter+subscription], however specifying the Services screen instead the Filter subscription.
fields.summary: Documentation for expressions in JIRA Services

 Add Instructions on Removing Home Data after setting the shared directory, and copying the content over.

For customers with large attachements it may make sense to go back and remove this content as to not have duplicated data sitting on disk.

  {panel}

h3. Summary
When a user selects a subtask from the Issue Details view and clicks the browser back button, the user is not taken back to the parent issue, but is instead taken to the backlog or issue search list.

h3. Environment
* Tested in Chrome in JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# View a list of issues (e.g. perform a search).
# Click on a specific issue so that the full-screen detail view of the issue (e.g. story) is displayed in the web browser.
# Click on an existing sub-task to drill into the details page of the sub-task.
# Now click the back button in your browser. Instead of being taken back to the parent story case, you are taken back to the list view.

h3. Expected Results
You should be taken back to the parent issue view.

h3. Actual Results
You are taken back to the list of issues before the parent issue was selected.
 
h3.Workaround
Navigate back to the parent task from the issue list.
fields.summary: Browser back button on subtask takes user to backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62419].
{panel}
h5. Summary

As described on JRA-62386:
{quote}When a saved filter contains a project, which JQL has the project name or project key, and a user that don't have permission to view this project access this filter, the project name/key in the filter change to its database ID to all users accessing this filter.
{quote}
This makes Pie Chart gadgets unavailable for all customers.
h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter containing a project (or some projects), like project in (ABC, XYZ)
 # Save this filter sharing it publicly
 # Use the saved filter in a [Pie Chart gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-pie-chart-gadget-720417035.html]
 # Set another user to have permission to view projects ABC and XYZ
 # With this user, access a Dashboard with the Pie Chart gadget.
 # Set a third user not to have permission in one of the projects (ABC or XYZ)
 # With this third user access a Dashboard with the Pie Chart gadget.
 # With the second user refresh the page.

h5. Expected Results

The Pie Chart should be displayed normally for the second user.
h5. Actual Results

It returns the following error: "Unfortunately, one or more of your preferences are now unavailable. Please update your preferences, or remove gadget by clicking delete from the title bar above."

Sometimes the pie chart gadget will show "Looks like we can't show you the content of this gadget due to its configuration. The filter could not be found. Check that it exists and that you have permission to see it."
h5. Workarounds
* Favorite/unfavorite the affected filter. This will flush the caches and the filter will be reloaded correctly.
* Share the filter only with groups/users that have permission to view the projects in the filter
fields.summary: Filters affected by JRA-62386 are breaking Pie Charts

h3. Summary
JIRA bundled plugins are marked as *User-installed*

* Entity property conditions - This plugin implement entity property webfragment conditions in JIRA.
* Filter Deletion Warning Plugin - A plugin that provides warnings when deleting saved filters
* JIRA Feature Keys - This plugin registers feature keys supplied by JIRA.
* Soy Function Plugin - Contains functions for Soy framework 

h3. Expected Results
They are marked as *System*

h3. Actual Results
Plugins are marked as *User-installed*
 
h3. Notes
JIRA administrator is confused and this causes problems like [Unrecognized function 'getJiraHelpUrl'|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unrecognized-function-getjirahelpurl-836601589.html]

h3.Workaround
None. This plugins shouldn't be disabled.
fields.summary: JIRA bundled plugins are marked as User-installed

h3. Summary
When using the advanced JQL search function in Issue Navigator, fixVersions are not filtered based on the project you are searching against. Instead, a larger list of fixVerions is rendered. In addition, this fixVersion list will persist to render no matter what project you start your query with.

h3. Environment
Cloud - 1000.305.0
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Issue Navigator 
# Click on Advanced to display the advanced JQL text box
# Use a query like: project = "replaceWithYourProjectKey" AND fixVersion = 
- Pay attention to the list of fixVersions listed
# Change the projectKey in your query to a different project

h3. Expected Results
The list of fixVersions should filter based on the project queried against

h3. Actual Results
The fixVersion list will list fixVersions in all projects
 
h3. Notes
The basic JQL query tool will filter fixVersions based on the project selected

h3.Workaround
Users can utilize the basic JQL query tool which will filter fixVersions based on the project that is selected

when installation Jira on premise as a standard installation (by unpacking the .zip, rpm, whatever) the underlying Tomcat is using JSESSIONID for his session cookies.
This leads to weird logout-situations when running multiple products (Jira, Confluence, etc.) on the same server.

*Suggestion:*
change the CookieName in the default context as suggested in your knowledgebase article in all downloadable packages:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/logging-into-another-atlassian-application-logs-me-out-of-confluence-268043930.html
fields.summary: Change default CookieName in standard installations

h3. Summary

In case that JIRA is integrated with external directories, remember-me token should be ignored when users managed in the directories log in JIRA at least.
The root need is that users can still log in after an administrator forces a password change (due to the remember-me token).

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 7.2.0
 * Crowd 2.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate JIRA with Crowd
 # Log in JIRA with a user (User A) and then, check "Remember my login on this computer"
 # Restart the browser
 # Access JIRA with the same browser

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should show login page and need User A to input the credentials
h3. Actual Results

User A could log in without any authentication.
h3. Notes
 * The above actual results might cause some troubles in the following scenario{panel}_In case that there are some password leakages, an admin of the external directories wants the users to update their passwords immediately._
 # In the past, User A logged in JIRA with checking "Remember my login on this computer"
 # An admin of Crowd notices that a password of User A was leaked
 # The admin access Crowd, open user setting page of User A and set an attribute called "requiresPasswordChange" as "true" (It would require User A to update the password when the next login.)
 # In spite of the above setting, User A can log in JIRA without updating the password{panel}
* Confluence, Bitbucket Server and Bamboo behave as well at this moment

h3. Workaround

Disabling remember-me token is only the workaround.
fields.summary: When a password in an external directory is reset, Administrators should have an option to invalidate 'remember me' tokens

JIRA
Permissions General Overview
<https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Permissions+General+Overview?src=mail&src.mail.timestamp=1472570448441&src.mail.notification=com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-content-notifications-plugin%3Apage-edited-notification&src.mail.recipient=ff8081813fe690d5013fe88f358c016e&src.mail.action=view>
JIRA has a flexible security system which allows you to configure who can
access JIRA, and what they can do/see within JIRA. There are five types of
security within JIRA:
1. Global permissions
<https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-global-permissions-776636359.html>
-
these apply to JIRA as a whole (e.g. who can log in).
2. Project permissions
<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Permissions>
organised into permission schemes, these apply to projects as a whole
(e.g. who can see the project's issues ('Browse' permission), create, edit
and assign them).
3. Issue security levels
<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Issue-level+Security>-
organised into security schemes, these allow the visibility of individual
issues to be adjusted, within the bounds of the project's permissions.
4. Comment visibility
<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Commenting+on+an+Issue> -
allows the visibility of individual comments (within an issue) to be
restricted.
5. Work-log visibility
<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Logging+Work+on+an+Issue> -
allows the visibility of individual work-log entries (within an issue) to
be restricted. Does not restrict visibility of progress bar on issue time
tracking.
Different Projects, Different Permissions
Permission schemes allow you to apply varying access levels to combinations
of groups, roles and individuals on a per-project basis. A permission
scheme will enable/disable specific actions for users for that project. For
example, the 'Browse Project' permission for a particular project restricts
who can view the project in JIRA and thus view issues that belong to that
project via the Issue Navigator. Without this permission, user(s) would not
be able to access ('browse') that project.
You could have permission schemes applied per project that give certain
customer groups or roles access only to the project (via the 'Browse
Project' permission) that pertains to them, while giving the internal
groups or roles all permissions across multiple projects. See Managing
Project Permissions <http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/ZAISCw> for further
details.
Reusable Permission Schemes: Using Project Roles (default and recommended)
Each project has Project Roles associated with it: Project Lead,
Administrators, Developers, and Users. As you define your Permission
Scheme, you can assign permissions in your Permission Scheme to a Project
Role (e.g. Project Role (Users)). When you select the Permission Scheme for
a project, JIRA will grant the permissions specified in the scheme to the
specific users/groups that you've defined in the Project Roles for your
project.
This allows you to reuse the same Permission Scheme for different projects
that have the same security needs, but different groups. You then select
the same Permission Scheme for the Project, but Manage Project Role
Membership
<http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Project+Role+Membership>
to substitute different users/groups. Sharing a Permission Scheme also
facilitates the creation of Administrator groups across the projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62392].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customers would like the ability within the Issue Navigator of JIRA to display the timestamp for date fields such as Created date.   Natively there is not a supported way to accomplish this within JIRA.  However there was a KB article created over at [Showing Extended Timestamp in the Created Column of the Issue Navigator|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Showing+Extended+Timestamp+in+the+Created+Column+of+the+Issue+Navigator], that explained a means to customize the file 'date-columnview.vm' directly to accomplish this.

The problem now is that those instructions no longer valid to JIRA 7.x versions.   Those instructions only appear to work for JIRA 6.4.x and before.  Presumably the code changes in JIRA 7 altered the way in which these .vm files are used to render the issue navigator results page.


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow JIRA administrators to customize the view of this issue navigator to include timestamps
OR
Provide an alternative work-around that might explain how this could be customized on a JIRA 7.x platform.
fields.summary: Showing Extended Timestamp in the Created Column of the Issue Navigator in JIRA 7

fields.description:
h3. Expected Behavior

Capture for JIRA Plugin should be compatible with JIRA 7.2.
h3. Actual Behavior

Capture for JIRA is marked as incompatible with JIRA 7.2, however, its functionality seems to be unaffected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA 7.2.0;
 # Go to *Administration > Add-ons > Find new add-ons*;
 # "Capture for JIRA" will not be found because, according to [its Marketplace page|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar/server/overview], it doesn't have any version compatible with JIRA 7.2;

h3. Workaround

Download the JAR file for the latest version of "Capture for JIRA" 2.9.7 from MPAC and upload it manually into JIRA through *Administration > Add-ons > Manage add-ons*.

We aren't aware of any incompatibility problems, but we cannot guarantee full functionality without a certified compatible version.
fields.summary: Update/certify JIRA Capture Plugin for compatibility with JIRA 7.2

fields.description:
Currently there exists a number of different links within our knowledge base in regards to integrating JIRA with Perforce.  Previous incarnations of this integration used a now deprecated plugin for JIRA.  In the current state, JIRA requires the use of Fisheye in order to integrate Perforce with JIRA.   It would help if there was a more clear distinction between these two different integration methods to help clarify which documented steps apply to which configuration and which do not.

While there does exist some screenshot to help explain how this integration can be configured over on https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/display/FISH/Mapping+Custom+Fields  Those screenshots appear to have been created back in JIRA 3.x or 4.x, and it would help to have an updated visual explanation of how this can be configured in both current JIRA and current Perforce.
fields.summary: Update Perforce JIRA integration documentation and screenshots

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62387].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When changes are made to specific fields within a workflow, the only method of tracking these changes is by looking through the specific tickets history. It would be nice to be able to see changes made to a specific field within a given project by having a report available that does this.

h3. Environment
Cloud - Current
Server - Current

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an existing project
# Click on Reports

h3. Expected Results
A report that will allow you to view field changes is available

h3. Actual Results
There is currently no report that tracks field changes and total number of times the field has been changed
 
h3. Notes
A specific use case for this would be tracking changes made to a date field titled: Due Date
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I would like to be able to run a report that will show me changes made to specific fields with a given project.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62386].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When a saved filter contains a project, which JQL has the project name or project key, and a user that don't have permission to view this project access this filter, the project name/key in the filter change to its database ID to all users accessing this filter. This breaks many functionalities that depend on this filter, like dashboard gadgets and also the the list of boards that appear under a project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter containing a project (or some projects), like project in (ABC, XYZ)
 # Save this filter sharing it publicly
 # Set another user to have permission to view projects ABC and XYZ
 # With this user click Issues > View all filters and search by the saved filter on #2 and open it
 # Set a third user not to have permission in one of the projects (ABC or XYZ)
 # With this third user click Issues > View all filters and search by the saved filter on #2 and open it
 # With the second user refresh the page showing the filter

h3. Expected Results

The filter shouldn't change the project name/key to ID for the users that have permission to view all projects in the filter
h3. Actual Results

The filter changes from project name/key to the project's database ID even for the users that have permission to view all projects in the filter
h3. Notes

This does not update the database entries for the filters. Restarting the JIRA Application will refresh the filter data back to the project names, temporarily until the filter is accessed again by someone without permissions.
h3. Workarounds
* Favorite/unfavorite the affected filter. This will flush the caches and the filter will be reloaded correctly.
* Share the filter only with groups/users that have permission to view the projects in the filter
fields.summary: Saved filter corrupted when accessed by a user without permission to view all projects referenced in the filter
